byline.original: By AL BAKER and ROB HARRIS

abstract: New York City Police Officer Michael Carey testifies at departmental administrative trial that he believed he heard gunshots coming from inside Sean Bell's car in 2006; Carey, who has been charged with failing to comply with departmental guidelines in firing his gun, maintains his innocence.
snippet: At an administrative trial, Officer Michael Carey echoed his description of the shooting of Sean Bell that he gave at his colleagues’ criminal trial.
lead_paragraph: At an administrative trial, Officer Michael Carey echoed his description of the shooting of Sean Bell that he gave at his colleagues’ criminal trial.

headline.main: Officer Says He Thought Someone in Sean Bell’s Car Was Returning Fire
headline.print_headline: Officer Says He Thought Someone in Sean Bell’s Car Was Returning Fire
headline.seo: Michael Carey Testifies in Bell Shooting Police Trial
